exception.impl: The implementation used cannot create VectorsControl controls.
exception.size: The selected file exceeds the maximum 20 MB allowed.
exception.no_geoms: No geometries have been detected in this file.
exception.load_correct: Error when loading the file. Check that it is the right file.
exception.extension: A not allowed file extension has been inserted. The allowed ones are: KML, SHP(.zip), GPX, GML and GeoJSON.
exception.no_features: This layer does not yet have any entities. Add entities first.
exception.query_profile: The altitude data for this entity could not be queried.
exception.capabilities: An error has occurred in obtaining the GetCapabilities document
exception.valid_url: You must provide a valid URL
exception.error_features_wfs: Unable to load layer features. Try increasing the zoom level in the area of interest.
exception.error_no_features_wfs: Unable to load layer features. Try again in another area.
exception.wfs_zoom: Increase the zoom in * levels if you want to add this WFS service
exception.error_email: The email could not be sent.
exception.error_email_exception: The message could not be sent, possibly due to the size of the attached file.
exception.error_email_size: The weight limit for mail has been exceeded. Reduce the size of the attached file or contact consulta@cnig.es if you want to send the file.

textHelp.help1: The InciCarto extension allows you to send a digitized or uploaded geographic object to the viewer in an email.
textHelp.help2: The extension is customizable, so it can change from one viewer to another.
textHelp.help3: In the initial panel of the extension, an explanation of its use is made: a point/line/surface is digitized or a vector file is uploaded and click to start the process of sending the incident.
textHelp.help4: In the simple case of the extension, you can choose a topic (associated with a destination email) and the user can fill in their name, their email for follow-up, a description and attach a file.
textHelp.help5: In the advanced case, you can choose a topic, the type of error, the producer and the recipients.
textHelp.help6: At the user level you can fill in the name, the email to which follow-up notifications are sent and the description.
textHelp.help7: In addition, you can attach a file to the email.
textHelp.help8: Clicking the send email button sends an email to the selected recipient email address.
textHelp.help9: When you click the send email button, the recipient receives an email with the content of the incident filled out by the user, a geojson with the digitized layer and the attached file in case the user has uploaded one.
textHelp.help10: The information relevant to the extension and its possible parameterization is documented in
textHelp.help11: The example of use of its parameters can be checked in

accepted: The accepted formats are KML, SHP (.zip), GPX, GML and GeoJSON.
title: Title
try_again: The query could not be executed. Please try again later
email_correct: The email with the incident has been sent correctly.
